messages.body: $TSLA By 2030, eight-million barrels a day get displaced https://www.google.com/amp/s/ep.probeinternational.org/2016/02/26/lawrence-solomon-forget-the-old-peak-oil-theory-now-the-oil-industrys-doom-will-be-its-everlasting-supply/amp/?client=safari

links.title: Lawrence Solomon: Forget the old Peak Oil theory, now the oil industry's doom will be its everlasting supply
links.description: This article, by Lawrence Solomon, first appeared in the National Post Peak-oil theorists - they're the ones who predicted $300-a-barrel oil, because new discoveries wouldn't materialize - were fundamentally right after all. So they say. No, not about the $300 price tag.

messages.body: $TSLA Our EV projections require sales to grow by around 25% per annum between now and 2035 http://www.bhpbilliton.com/media-and-insights/prospects/2016/09/electric-vehicles-why-all-the-noise

links.title: Electric vehicles - why all the noise?
links.description: The world uses almost 100 million barrels of oil 1 every day. One quarter of those barrels are consumed by light vehicles and when you combine all road, water, rail and air traffic, transportation's share of oil demand is more than 50%.

messages.body: $TSLA Tesla, Tesla, Tesla! After 3 years of consolidation, here we go!

$TSLA “We would be the fourth largest supplier in the world if we were to actually take advantage of our lithium.” https://evannex.com/blogs/news/tesla-battery-a-trip-to-the-driest-place-on-earth-in-search-of-lithium?utm_source=elonmusknews

links.title: Finding Lithium: Tesla, the lithium-ion battery, and its humble beginnings [Video]
links.description: Is lithium the new white gold? Scare stories about a shortage seem to have little basis in fact (lithium isn't a fuel, it's abundant and highly recyclable, and batteries don't really use that much of it). However, there's no question that demand is soaring, and entrepreneurs around the world are scrambling to secure supplies of the stuff.

links.title: Tesla's massive batteries are powering everything from exotic islands to breweries
links.description: In November, Tesla announced it was powering nearly the entire island of Ta'u in American Samoa using solar power and packs of its massive commercial battery, the Powerpack 2. The announcement, made just a few days after Tesla acquired SolarCity, showed a bigger push by the automaker to grow its energy business.

links.title: The Surprising Reason Tesla Could Jump 25%
links.description: Perhaps Donald Trump will eventually add a few Teslas to his motorcade. The "surprisingly supportive political environment" is one reason why Morgan Stanley analyst Adam Jonas just upgraded Tesla Motors shares to "Overweight," recommending that clients buy the stock. Jonas thinks it could rise to $305, 25% above current levels.
